title: Yes, you can run Windows 11 on your Mac — and it’s only $15
content:
Macworld

If you’ve got an Intel-based Mac, you don’t need to ditch Apple just to run Windows — Boot Camp lets you install Windows 11 Pro alongside macOS. You’ll get full access to the OS, including built-in AI tools like Copilot, as well as features like Snap Layouts and BitLocker. This license works with x64-based systems, so it’s fully compatible with Intel-based Macs (not M1, M2, or M3). You’ll need at least 64GB of free disk space and some time to set it up.

And if you’re second computer is a PC, you’ll want to hear this: Windows 10 support ends in October, and that means no more security updates. For just $14.97, this Windows 11 Pro license is a smart way to upgrade, especially with the gaming performance boost from DirectX 12 Ultimate and new AI-powered productivity tools.

Whether you’re dual-booting on a Mac or upgrading your PC, this one-time license helps you skip monthly fees and stay ahead of being obsolete.

Upgrade your Mac or PC with Windows 11 Pro for just $14.97 until 6/1.
